Good place to have a drink while waiting for your flight and I'm sure nothing more. We had the spicy mango margarita and the strawberry margarita with chips and salsa for snacking. The salsa was nothing special but these margaritas are big! I definitely was feeling it after  my one spicy mango margarita.

Seat yourself restaurant. They probably just had a rush of customers. When I was trying to find a seat. Most tables was taken up with dirty dishes. The staff wasn't particularly friendly but took my order quick and I was served fairly quickly. I ordered the taco salad w/chicken and a shock top beer, the salad is pretty decent and beer though, I got a price 'shock' when I got the bill. My draft beer was $9.75 while my salad was $12.49. Should've asked the price of beer before I ordered it.

Go anywhere else in this airport for food! Worst food ever. BLAAAAARG! My meat gobbling, bovine slaying, leather wearing husband ordered a breakfast burrito that was bland with tasteless previously frozen and hard homefries and I had a nasty vegan burrito. I get these whenever I eat Mexican and I have never had a bad one....until now. Disgusting. Service leaves a lot to be desired as well. Hubby's eyebrows speak to his extreme distaste..no Bueno.

Wow. Anyone impressed with this place must be coming here at 6 am and still be drunk. Service was slow and sloppy. One you get your food you will not see your waitress again. I have seen no less than 6 people get up and hunt down their waitress so they could pay their bill and leave. The table behind me for up and left in a fury as they had been sitting there for over 30 minutes without service.  Food is so-so at best. But what can you expect from an airport place.

Absolutely the worst Mexican food I have ever eaten.  I would honestly say that Taco Bell is more authentic and a better quality. The burrito was $13.00 and was the size of what you would traditionally see in a kids menu. Rushed service and dirty tables.

It's a bar in an airport...so reasonably priced drinks are right out the window...service is basic at best and out of the three times i've eaten there twice the food came out luke warm, not hot. If you are going to spend 10 bucks, you might as well go to the overpriced Burger King down the way for food.
Drinks were great we did not eat but atmosphere was perfect! Kara Pendleton was fantastic. Friendly, kind, attentive, and extremely professional!

I go to Las Vegas now and then for actual work meetings. On those trips, you can find me quick in a crowd - I'm the only female in the vicinity wearing clothes that offer modest coverage, looking very, very sober and very, very pale. 

As I result, I've become familiar with the Southwest terminal at McCarran, which is a pretty painful experience: crowded and loud, with poor people-traffic flow. And speaking of the other people, these thoughts often alternate in my head: 

1) "Why are all these parents bringing small children to Las Vegas?" 
2) "Who invited all these tacky people to this airport?"

Back to the children, I'm often attempting to look as unfriendly as possible on the Southwest flight so no one with kids sits next to me. It's a useless effort, but a fight worth fighting to the bitter end. I choose a seat far in the back and unleash a campaign of intimidation - irritated snobby expression, weird flipping through high-end fashion magazine, gum chewing ... and often pretend-sniffling and nose-blowing. In my head, I think "this activity makes me look very unfriendly. I'm a materialistic rude person with a cold. You don't want your kids to sit next to me." The truth is, I'm a pushover who loves babies, just not loud babies in close proximity at 30,000 feet. 

Unfortunately, this attack plan never works. People see a nicely dressed petite business woman and think "she probably smells okay. I'll sit next to her and take her arm rest."

So these days, with the help of Tequileria, I bring in my last line of defense: booze. Ideally, after a quick trip to said Tequileria, you carry that telltale I've-had-a-cocktail scent as you squeeze into the boarding line. Parents would hopefully take note and not seat their kids next to the Drinking Lady. But then, if they still do, you're infused with 20 ounces of sixteen-dollar strawberry margarita and can't feel your soul. Surefire solution. 

Can't say I've had the food. Don't really like the crowded tables or airport-style service that has you wondering if someone will come take your order. But this is my ardent message to business travelers at McCarran - hit this place up pre-flight, because LAS to OAK via Southwest appears to carry a five-screaming-toddler minimum. 

Cheers to self-medication.

Stopped here for drinks on our way out of Vegas.  The set up was cool but the service was not good at all.  They seemed to have the right server to table ratio but for whatever reason it took a while to get our order, even though it was just drinks.  For round two I just walked up to the bar then the bartender told me if I was dining in I should order through the waitress...  I told him it was taking forever and he took my drink order.  On the bright side, the drink prices were reasonable.  If you have time, go somewhere else.

Server Michelle rocked it out for our group. A great way to end our Vegas seminar weekend.

Good food and zesty Margaritas . . . Lovin' this.

This place expensive, crappy service, crappy food.  It's way overpriced, even for an airport.  Not an enjoyable experience at all.  The $11 guacamole was seriously Costco guacamole!!!  I know..I buy it all the time...same flavor, ingredients, and texture.  It was not guacamole you'd expect feel a restaurant.  Very disappointed.

Arrived in restaurant at 3:pm. Service is non-existent. They wouldn't acknowledge our presence. Table was dirty. We waited at least 10 minutes, then left. This location is a turkey. No need to waste your time there.

We hit this place on a Saturday morning when the airport was crazy busy. It seemed to my wife and I that the restaurant was under staffed to handle to nearly full dining area. We had eaten lunch here before so we thought we would try it for breakfast.

The service was very slow due to the crowd but our server was very friendly. The food is not bad, considering you are eating at the airport. If you are looking for great Mexican food, this ain't it but, again, you are at the airport! It won't hurt you, so give it a try if you have some spare time before your flight.

Not many options so the half packed restaurant seems like a decent choice at first.  Wait staff hardly working but many tables waiting to close out and others waiting to get their order taken.  I've witnessed customers getting up to get straws and napkins from the bar.  The food is mediocre and not worth the wait.

Disclaimer: this is a service-related review only. Didn't get to try their food. An extremely cranky server barked at myself and another woman at the table next to me (after we waited patiently for 20 minutes to be acknowledged) that it was going to be a 'really long time' before she'd get to us and another 30 minutes at least to get our order. It was the way she said it, so crazy rude I was taken aback, she basically yelled at us. The wait I didn't mind, but was too damn tired for that miserable surly attitude so I promptly walked out.

HOLA! Greeted as if you were in "Mexico" Jose Cuervo's Tequileria tries to make you feel 'at home'here at the end of the C Terminal of the Las Vegas, McCarran Airport near Gate C16.

Ironically (and with good reason since its Jose Cuervo's Restaurant), the tequila choices are limited to Jose Cuervo Tequilas...

They play some good Spanish language music to put you in the mood to drink excessively and the food is extra tasty (meaning salty) to help induce thirst. What more can you expect to get in an airport in Las Vegas, Nevada. I ordered an "Asada" burrito with "steak" and got shredded beef, lettuce, cheese and salsa wrapped up in a warm tortilla. It is clear that their interpretation of Spanish words is questionable, but in the end, I was hungry and it was tasty (meaning salty) and had I been on a weekend long drinking binge in Sin City, I would have needed a burrito of this caliber to get me back to reality. Truly the one thing that doesn't stay in Vagas are the ailments (or diseases) which you acquire there.  

I ordered something simple, a beer, and was coerced into buying a 4 dollar Cuervo Silver Tequila Shot. I got the shot pretty quick, and began to sip on it... but the beer took about 20 minutes due to "keg" issues. Understandable, but I didn't get any "we're sorry" discount - Whatever, how often will I ever be here?

Overall, it's good if you have a two hour layover, in the Las Vegas McCarran Airport at Gate C16, but then, it's an airport and expecting an excellent restaurant with excellent service and selection is like asking for world peace: many will try, but it sure as hell will never happen. There is Wi-Fi available also if you want to catch up with your life while living your imaginary one in Vegas. And there is nothing more awesome than busting out your laptop and chatting with the world while enjoying a beer at the Las Vegas airport - I hear people really respect that. 

Beer + a shot + Tax and Tip = $15, I guess they never stop robbing you in this town. Burrito was $7 and about the size of a glorified spring roll.
For $13, I had a watery itty bitty banana margarita that was all sweet and no substance. My waitress was nice and the restaurant is pretty.

This place just sucks ill take taco bell over this place and margaritas were horrible just tastes like margarita mix not to mention the prices for the margs were outrageous but then again what do you expect for airport food?

Foul play! Sticker shock.

Talk about price gouging. Check the beverage price before you order. If it''s not listed (which many are not) you may not be able to afford it.

Limited menu, but good drinks and great service. Our server, Leah, was lovely.  She really made the experience.

House margs run about $12, but they are tasty.  Doubles near $15.  

Menu doesn't seem veggie friendly at first, but they are very accommodating. Rice and black beans are vegetarian. 

Good option to wait out a late flight or get a bite before you head out.

Seat yourself works great at a place where there isn't anyone looking for a place to sit... at say, AN AIRPORT. The overly aggressive waiter made me feel like a homeless person and rushed me to make a decision. I got up and left. 

1 person tells hundreds, and your place is already a ghost town good luck suck!

Great news !!! They changed the menu! And it's awesome !!! The chips & salsa is amazing ! I got the hot one. The mahi mahi tacos were some of the best I've had! They don't have fresh jalapeños and are kinda pricey but it's the airport. The portions were larger than before also. I will come back when I'm passing through again for sure.
For airport food and drink, this place isn't bad.

on 2/20/14 around 9pm, I had a lay over at LV, and we made the worst decision to order some drinks in this place. we have five people in our group, and each one of us ordered a drink. by the end, we paid the bill with cash, and i saw with my very eyes that we have put in $65 dollars which including $5 tip. after the short, fat, and dark haired waitress took our dollars, you couldn't imagine what happened next.
that very waitress chased us to the gate while were boarding the plane. she claimed that we only paid her $40 dollars and demand us to paid the rest of the bill. because we made the payment in cash, and we were in a hurry to board the plane. i paid $20 dollar to end the dispute and warn her that I will write this review to let everyone know how much this place suck.

stay away from this place... don't be fooled.

Ordered carnitas quesadilla and chips n salsa. Not enough salsa or choice of salsas. No garnish (pico, lettuce, etc) with the quesadilla. Just a little "swipe" of avocado crema. 
Not to mention the restaurant was grossly understaffed for a Friday night.  Everything took a while. Luckily my flight was delayed and I wasn't in a hurry. 
Server was friendly.

Esmeralda is the best waitress!  I was afraid to give this place a chance because of the reviews on here but I think they deserve a great review:) I ordered the chicken nachos.  That was a safe bet and was really good!  The waitress Esmeralda was attentive and did a great job! I'll be back!

It is the ONLY place in concourse C that looked halfway decent... and that's about the best thing that can be said of it. The food was okay, the portion reasonable (smaller than I'd have expected at a Mexican place, but frankly that is probably a good thing), prices not too bad. 

Of course, there is no metal silverware and the service is a step up from the TSA, but not exactly great.

And while the beer and non-alcholoic drinks were a bit expensive, they DID offer me a $4 shot to go with my beer. So they've got that going for them...

2.5 stars
Had wine and guacamole. Wine was fine. Guac was packaged and not hand made which is absurd. It's so easy to make. I was really disappointed. Chips were yucky too.

No bueno!  

Unfortunately bad decisions are sometimes made when I only have 35 minutes between switching planes while tempting margaritas are staring me in the face.  

Banana Margarita - There's no price on the drink menu, so my server said it was $14-$15, glad it only ended being $13.49.  The drink was good but came in a very small cup for the price.  

Chips and Guacamole - At almost $11 I figured, what the hey, it's going on the company expense report and it'll be my dinner.  It's the only thing I ordered and she brought out the wrong dish.  There was a delay in getting my receipt because she put in the right order but had to make a correction.  Instead she brought me Chips and Salsa, which was $6.49.  I said, "I actually ordered Chips and Guacamole."  She says she either take that back or she can add on a small side of guacamole for $1.89.  I don't have time for all this mess so I say, "Just bring me a small side of guacamole."  Well, the guacamole on the bill showed up as $2.89.  It was tiny!  Not to mention, it wasn't fresh made, nor was it packed a few days before at some local distributor, it was the canned stuff that was like a thick soup with no chunks of avocado.  The tortilla chips were like Mission Tortilla Chips, except triangular.  I hate Mission Tortilla Chips.  

If you want to stop here and get a drink, that's fine, but the food (not just my dish) seems to be lacking.  If you want to walk around with your drink, order it in a to go cup.  Las Vegas McCarran Airport is rad like that.

I used to like this place.  It was a nice place to chill and have a drink before your flight.  They had a good blue corn taco plate I enjoyed a lot. 

Today was a different story.  The nice menus were replaced with photocopied paper.  No more brewed or fountain tea,  only in bottles.  No more blue corn tacos.  Or a taco plate. 

I ordered the three carnitas tacos on corn tortillas.  I was hungry.  I thought something tasted funny,  and noticed into the second taco that they were flour tortillas.  I mentioned it to the server,  she acknowledged the error,  and took the plate away.  And brought me a plate of two corn shelled tacos,  instead of three.  Which were tasty, credit where credit due.  

As polite as the server was,  she kept mentioning that she was leaving soon,  to the point of annoyance. When she brought me my check,  she kept hovering to see if I signed my tab.  

Their tap beer selection is nothing special,  and there are other lounges in the terminal.  

I miss the old menu and selection of beverages.

Stopped here at the McCarran airport (LAS) in the Southwest terminal and the nachos with chicken appetizer was a generous serving for two people to make a meal out of.  There are little buttons on the table you can push to notify your server you're ready to pay, for example, because your flight is about to start boarding.

DONT GO HERE. This place is not worth it. At all. In any way.

Over priced beer, over priced food. Terrible service with a frown. Everything took forever to order and receive. However, the burrito I ordered was tasty .... and somewhat warm.

Sorry, if there was a no star vote, this gets it.

I live in Vegas & fly often... My nachos are cold, last call is before 9pm, my Bloody Mary is watered down & they even pulled the closing gate about 5 inches from where I'm sitting. Talk about a wonderful experience! NOT!

If you get service,  it's not good; it's more delivery service than customer service.   I'm in this airport weekly,  rarely stop in here unless with friends for a drink,  always filthy, tables piled with trash and they just keep moving from table to table.   Cleared my own table today,  but never got it wiped down while the staff just watched.

The food here was disgusting. Trapped in the airport, options are very limited so we decided to give this place a try for breakfast. The bacon was clearly precooked, the eggs were subpar, and the breakfast potatoes were room temperature and very apparently not fresh. I'm sure they microwaved whatever prefeozen potatoes they served the day before. The margaritas were overly sweet and the service was sparse. We would have been safer with a fast food option as opposed to this sit down place.

OK it's a given that Jose Cuervo is the Budweiser of tequila so you know the margaritas are going to suck really hard, but adding insult to injury they also charge you $17 for this crappy margarita.
After my first sip I wanted to shoot myself in the head. Avoid this place like the plague.

Best place in the airport to eat or drink, hands down. If you sit at the bar, you'll get in and out quick to make your layover flight. Simple beer menu, but the food is definitely something that will get you through a long flight. This is my go to spot at the airport

One of the many choices at LAS. The atmosphere is good young staff, a bit slow, learning but friendly. My order, the Chicmichanga is loaded with beef, nice portion size and good flavor. At $12.59, I was disappointed no chips or salsa, I had to ask. Mexican food for me includes chips, but we are at the Airport, another way to extract money.

Not bad, not bad. Service was kind of slow but it's an airport restaurant so it's to be expected. The food was pretty good, breakfast burrito was pretty flavorless but adding the salsa made it great. Home fries were amazing.
Asked a waitress if she was ours and she said NO and just kept walking...horrible service!

Pretty standard quality, service, and pricing for an airport venue. Which is to say that the only reason you are eating here is because you're trapped. With that said, the Blue Corn Quesadilla was tasty enough to devour, and they have beer on tap, making for an experience more gratifying than a food court.
Awful food with very slow service.

Simply put: rude waitress, bland tacos that fell apart, and enchiladas sopped in sour cream. Go elsewhere. Anywhere but here.

EDITED: morning after and I now have food poisoning. STEER CLEAR!!!!!!!!!

This restaurant was convenient for our wait here at the airport. For the price we got the nachos and they were not that worth it. The nachos were plain tasting and there was not enough cheese on the nachos either. The bud light was refreshing at the least. The flavored margaritas were watered down so I would recommend not to get that. The a/c was probably not working well since we were sitting there sweating. 2/5

This place is just bad. We were delayed over 5 hours coming home from Vegas and needed somewhere to eat lunch. Decided on this place and was not the best idea.

Ordered chips and salsa - the chips were not fresh, not even close to Tostitos quality. They were just bland bagged tortilla chips and the salsa was so watery and flavorless.

I ordered tacos with carne asada and I would have enjoyed a can of dog food more than I enjoyed this. The meat was really gross and the rice tasted like soggy nothing.

Don't go here. You're better off going to Burger King.
I have given this place a few tries, and they have failed everytime. Terrible service, weak drinks, and mediocre food. I definetly won't be stopping here anymore during my trips to vegas.

Wow, seriously bad service.  We were waiting for our flight and sat down to eat.  Waitresses walked by but nobody came even after 15 minutes.  I flagged one down but she gave me a dirty looked and walked the other way.  I tried to flag another and she just averted her eyes.

Finally someone came up and was rushing us along rudely.  Finally the food arrived, chips and salsa, 3 small tacos and a tortilla soup + 2 drinks... over $60.  Mind you I pay a lot of money for food sometimes, but this was horrible.  The Carne Asada tacos were dry. The seasoning was bad and the tortillas were dried up.  UGH...  My friend had the tortilla soup and she was very disappointed as well.  Bad service, bad food with expensive prices..:(

Decent Mexican food for an airport.  We arrived late, around 9:30, closing time was 10:00, but our server was pleasant and friendly.  I had the green chili pork burrito, and well, I could barely taste the green chili.  The salsa was decent.  The beans and rice I left mostly untouched.  Like I said, if you stuck in an airport after many delays and need a bite, this will suffice.

Was waiting for my connecting flight to  Nashville and I needed something to eat so I went to this restaurant.  I ordered an iced tea, and the three battered fish tacos.  The taco had a jicama and a white dressing. They were pretty good, it was expensive but that's what I expect from an airport.  If I am at the airport again, and I need to have something to eat, I would definitely go to this restaurant again.

I spent the majority of my day here. My flight was delayed a total of 7 hours, and I was stuck in the C gates, so this was pretty much it. Joey the bartender and I became airport buddies, and he was kind enough to grab OJ from the place next door so I could make a mimosa. I needed some food halfway thru my stay, I didn't have too high of expectations for this place, I went with nachos and added chicken. When it arrived in front of me, I wasn't sure what it was, were those tofu cubes? What the heck is that? Oh is that supposed to be chicken? Wowsa. I decided to eat around the mysterious cubes. 

I spent an obscene amount of money at the crap hole. I wish there were better options, but hey, gotta make the best of it.

Located in the C Gate area of Las Vegas airport it's a decent stop to get some nutrition or hang over medication. The expectations are low and most people just want a place to wait, get a drink while waiting for their flight. With the name Jose Cuervo I expected their signature Margarita to be kick @ss but found that to be a myth. It was like any supermarket margarita mix with mediocre Tequila. Now the Taco Salad with Barbacoa was excellent. see pics. Everything is overpriced because they have a captive audience $35 before tip for the drink and salad. 

Tip: ask for the check and pay your check right when the server brings your food so you don't have to flag down the server in the busy restaurant, so your not rushed to get your flight.

Literal interaction at the bar:

"Hi can I please get a glass of water?"

"Do you want a menu? Are you going to order any food?"

"I don't think so, but maybe. It's only 9:30am but I am kind of hungry, so potentially. I'm good with just water for right now."

"Seriously? No."

"What?"

"There's a water fountain around the corner."

"I mean I'll tip you obviously..."

*Bartender proceeds to ignore everything else I say.*

Not sure how you're training your employees, but it's a glass of water. It's not worth losing business over. 

To be fair, another bartender asked if he could help me as I was walking away, and laughed at the other bartender when I mentioned he had refused to serve me water. So eventually I did indeed wet my whistle thanks to the other bartender, and I tipped the guy for his kindness / normal human behavior.

As someone who has eaten at this chain a good amount (travel for work constantly), I was pretty shocked at how rude the first bartender was. I've taken note of it and will avoid eating at this chain at any point in the future.

The mission:  Acquire gluten-free, meat-free meal during one hour layover at LAS before connection to RNO.  

The Trap: Tequileria.  I looked at the menu in the resturant and thought, "Sweet!  I can get nachos."  Corn chips, optional meat.  Score.  

Think again.  I asked the bartender if I could place an order for take-out.  He directed me to the bastard stepchild restaurant outside of the restaurant, the Blue Burrito or Bad Burrito or something.  I went out there, asked if they did the same menu, and they didn't.  All meaty items w/ flour tortillas.  I went back into the restaurant to ask a server if they would do a quickie take-out order for me, and was quickly rebuffed.  Meat-free, gluten-free meal fail.  

I had a banana and a bottle of water before boarding my connection to RNO.  Fail for rude service and limited take-out options.  I would rate food if they would have served it to me.

Service was good, other than that this place has nothing going for it.
I paid 19 dollars for a small burrito that tasted like it was microwaved, and a really insultingly small side of guacamole.  Dining options are limited and lacking in the C terminal but... do yourself a favor and don't eat here. I think this place is here just to capitalize on the old burn outs that come to vegas and just don't care anymore about what they do to their bodies... but want to feel "adventurous," and eat "Mexican," food.

If you are stuck in terminal C, this is your only real sit down option outside of the modest food court. When the waitress asks you if you want some drinks, say yes because you are going to be waiting a while. The service is slow and harried, as this place is definitely a "turn and burn" restaurant, your seat will still be warm when you go to sit down. We ordered three taco salads, something that should be expedited, but even those took a little while.

The trick at McCarran if you want some real dining options is to take the shuttle to the baggage claim terminal and convince a TSA person to let you go across to the tram to the new Terminal 3 without having to go back through the checkpoint. That, however, can be time consuming. So if your time is limited, your options might be limited to this place if you want sit down service.

You're hungry and want to sit down in C gate. This place looked good, but greatly disappointed. The place was packed. Every seat taken. No hostess to seat anyone. Total free for all. Lots of people just sitting and hangin and hanging out on their phones after eating. Total chaos. The staff was not helpful. Other customers would walk in after us and get tables before. the chaos made it impossible to try to find a table and enjoy a meal. The only way we got a table was to find someone who just finished eating and ask if we could have their table. I ordered a chicken quesodislla and my other half ordered pork tacos. the waiter didn't write anything down and sent us the wrong orders. Twice. The chicken looked exactly like the pork but when we asked the waiter he said it was chicken. Wasn't impressed all. I would avoid this place and go for another option in terminal C

Ok so this is a glorified airport Chili's so I had low expectations to start with. My margarita is pretty good, but expensive. I wish I could tell you about the food. Fact of the matter is, I've been here for almost an hour now. No sign of my burrito. Aren't most people here in a hurry? 

This is going to need to be one delicious burrito. Too slow service for an airport. I should have walked the mile to the Moe's in the A gates. Lesson learned. 

Avoid.

We all have bad experiences with airport food, so no expectation at all, five of us went inside the restaurant because we had no choice, basically we were hungry and waiting for the connecting flight.

We ordered Chicken Enchiladas, Burrito, Quesadilla, chips and salsa, along with a few other drinks. To our pleasant surprise, everything was palatable. The presentation was neat, service was friendly and the food was delectable.

All of us liked whatever we ordered. And we all shared the sentiment that is it unlikely of the food that we get from other restaurants in airports.

Food was decent. Chips and salsa pretty good. But be forewarned: they do NOT offer ranch dressing! Our waiter was rather disgruntled when I asked. A little pretentious if you ask me. He was in sass mode 2.0.

We were stuck at the airport for four hours. After blowing through our snacks and going to Starbucks twice, I had to make one of the toughest decisions I've made on any vacation. I had to choose a place to eat. Because I have celiac, I can't eat just anywhere so I figured the corn tortilla chicken tacos were the safest option. I prayed I wouldn't get sick. The tacos were mostly gross. The needed salt, the salsa tasted store bought, and the salsa was very watery. We were stuck in the airport five more hours. Thankfully the tacos held us over and we were not sick!! It was kind of like being stranded in the woods and choosing the safest carcass to eat in order to survive.

It was $14 for three chicken tacos, decent size.

Service was terrible and not attentive at all. Ordered some chicken wings and they said it would take 20 minutes to finish. The order was a bit late and I was afraid of missing my flight and they were unwilling to refund me or cancel my order for something else. 

Avoid....at all costs. The bagel shop across the street is better. Or Popeyes.

If I could give 0, or simply push a button and close a place, I would. The food was overpriced (it is an airport and it is to be expected), the beverages are the same (again, airport) but the service is awful.  I can handle expensive food that is mediocre in an airport.  I will survive. I cannot deal with service this awful.  I had 2 hours before my flight, ordered a burrito, beer, and chips.  I had to run to get on.  When I ordered I asked if it came with chips and salsa, and was told a small portion, at which point I ordered a side of chips and salsa "to get with my beer, because I haven't really eaten all day."  My beer took 15 minutes and came sans chips and salsa.   I asked again, and another 20 minutes later it came out.  Finally, my burrito arrived, and my beer was almost gone.  She didn't stop to let me order another, or even come check if I wanted one when it was gone.  I thought beverages were where establishments  made their big bucks?  I guess not. 

Finally, when I could get her attention (after being done for 30 minutes without her coming back) I asked for my check.  Then I asked again, and again.  I finally had to get up and walk up to the front and demand that they let me pay before I missed my flight.  It was ABSURD.  I get the feeling this became a self fulfilling stereotype.  Older individuals got far superior service, and I am sure she thought "young guy, probably tips poorly."  Damn right I do when I almost miss my flight after asking for my bill three times, and I only have one beer in me after an hour and forty-five minutes.  Give me service, and you get a good tip, give me that kind of service and you don't.  I travel through this airport fairly often these days, and will never be returning here.

This is one of the worst places I've ever eaten, domestically or internationally. It's hard to say whether the food or the service is the most offensive. The table was filthy and the menu covered with an unidentifiable yellow pudding-like substance.  After being ignored for 15 minutes, the waiter finally came and took our orders with an abrupt, hurried manner. He seemed annoyed when asked to wipe the grimy table. The dining room was filled with dirty un-bussed tables and the employees chatting in small clusters concentrating on anything other than customer service. When the food finally came, it was cold and held the dull matte finish of food that's set for awhile before being served.  The worst part is that the place seems unhygienic, a characteristic that is unacceptable in a restaurant. The place has a captive airport audience so it might survive but the management and owners have nothing to be proud of.
Poor waitresses can't come up with enough excuses why the food is sooooo slow. Food was ok but I am glad I didn't have a flight right away or I would have starved to death.

This one star goes to this place for playing the Warriors game along with the Lakers game on a legendary night in basketball history. My girls and I were headed back to the Bay Area from a short Vegas trip and wanted nothing else but to watch the Warrior game on TV before we boarded our flight. If you didn't know already, Vegas is primarily an LA Laker zone (apparently) and Kobe was having his last game that night... of course everyone wanted to see it! But, it was also the night that the Warriors would break the Chicago Bull's  most wins in a single season record. Having both games on was TOTALLY NECESSARY! Thank goodness this place decided to play both games (unlike every other bar in the airport).

Enough of that, besides the basketball games, this place was nothing but uncomfortable. The workers here were just talking smack to each other and discussing their personal problems outright in front of all us customers. If that wasn't uncomfortable enough, one party who was trying to get seated seemed so uneasy about how the servers talked to each other, that they just straight up walked out of the place. Lastly, one of our friends who met up with us had to literally get out of her seat to seek out someone to take her drink order. She wanted to order a margarita, and about three servers just replied with, "Not my section!" Or, "Your server should be coming." About twenty minutes of searching for a willing worker, the bartender said, "Oh honey, you've been waiting too long. Let me just take your drink order." 

Although I didn't take a bite of their food, I wouldn't recommend for anyone to waste their time here unless this place is the only one playing what you want on TV. Sadly, that was the highlight of this experience.

This is a great place to relax while waiting for a flight. It's so good that in fact, once I lost track of time and missed my flight!! If I'm in Termnial C, this is my go-to if I have to wait for over an hour. If you're short on time, be aware, service can be slow, so let your server know from the get-go you're in a rush.

The food is pretty gosh darn good for an airport. They have blue corn tacos, and there are some smaller, lighter plates if you want to eat healtier and actually take the time to read the menu. And of course, Jose Cuervo is in the name. 'Nuff said.
A great place to have some Food and grab some Drinks while you wait for your connecting Flight. Just a fair warning, the margaritas cost as much as the food does but you are in the Las Vegas Airport!

This is a terrible over priced restaraunt! Don't waste your money on the horrible food and service here. Our server want too enthused to be helping us. We ordered chips and guacamole, both seemed to be prepackaged, I was really hoping for some home made chips! These seemed to be Tostitos chips from the grocery store. We ordered a chicken quesadilla and chicken tacos. The quesadilla was better than the tacos but that's not saying much. The tacos were nasty.. Reminded me of cafeteria food. It would have been one thing if we paid $6. But we ordered chips, guacamole, tacos, an ice tea, and a quesadilla and it came to $42.50. Taco Bell is much better.

Great food and fine margaritas. Their Platino Margarita is as good as they get (just tequila, fresh lime juice and agave nectar) and the carnitas tacos were delicious. Recommended if you have to be at Vegas airport.

Don't do it! I would rather eat Taco Bell out of a public trash can. Sooooooo gross and of course way over priced. If I could give a negative star,I would. Unfortunately we had the pork chimichonga & chicken nachos,yucky.

Our server was wonderful and friendly. Very attentive and we were greeted as soon as we came in. The food was great! I highly recommend the tortilla soup, which came with fresh avocado on top. The prices were inflated per usual with anything airport related.

Needed to kill some time while waiting for a flight. We had an awesome margarita. We also ordered nachos with chicken but those were just meh. The server we had, I believe her name was Theresa, was awesome. She was very attentive and made sure we had everything we needed.

Skip it, seriously. Go to burger king or somewhere else. I had the taquitos, which were NOTHING special, and the salsa tasted more like italian tomato sauce. I should have gotten the enchiladas, which my dad ordered, but he didn't care for his, either.

what else was i gonna do while waiting for my delayed flight??? for all that know me, you know i'd be getting a margarita.

i guess it was ok. to me, it was a typical over priced airport joint.
i got the $16 margarita! wow, $16!
i sat at the bar and the bartender was pretty cool. i even got to see a little love (lust) connection developing next to me between 2 travelers. 

i probably wont be coming back here.
oh well....

Is this place serious?! The Manager here needs to be fired. I had to interject at the Manager making excuses at a nearby table. What a joke. This place should be happy it is so busy. Hire more help and quit complaining to your paying customers. Time for a new restaurant at LAS.

Stopped by for some Nachos that I have been craving for a while and I had a few hours to burn in the airport.  Price was not bad compared to the other places in the C terminal.  Popeyes chicken was 10 bucks for a three piece meal so I my pulled pork nachos weren't that far off.  I ordered them and they came pretty quick.  The order was huge, with two types of salsa on the side.  If I ordered meatless Nachos I would say this is a 3 star meal, but the nachos came with about 2 tablespoons of pork.  I literally had to search my plate at first for any signs of meat.  Also, might be coincidence, but within 15 minutes of finishing and paying for meal I had to make an emergency run to the restroom.  One time shot, but it certainly did not agree with me.  Next time might try Popeyes!

Do we review airport food the same way we review other restaurants? Is the standard, "Please God, just don't let me be sick on the plane."? The truth is, we're waiting, and we just want a place to eat or drink that makes that wait less painful. So, here it is. This place made my early morning wait less painful. Service was cheery and attentive. The price didn't send me into a rage. The set up inside made an attempt to have some modern style, and is far roomier than most airport eateries. The food didn't poison me. Sure, I will never remember it for being good or bad. In fact, I'm not sure I remember it at all. What was I talking about again?

Well what could you possibly expect from a mexican restaurant brought to you by the folks who brought you Jose Cuervo tequila (One drink... and you'll never drink tequila again!)?  In the Las Vegas airport?  I mean- low expectations, right?  I thought the service was courteous and efficient.  They had chalula hot sauce on the table.  My chicken quesadilla was a good value for the money- which I believe is something I have never said about any meal I've ever eaten at an airport ever.  They have those cool Oaxacan animal sculptures as decoration.  It is what is, but it has got to be the best restaurant the "C" wing of McCarran airport has to offer.
You can sum this place up in two words. No. flavor.  The margarita was terrible and tasted like crushed ice. The food had no flavor whatsoever as well.  Save your money and skip this place.

I know it's airport food, but it's still very overpriced. There was old food and drinks on every empty table when we walked in, and it took forever for them to clean up so we could sit down. The food is decent and the atmosphere is nice, but the service and price makes it hard to give the Jose Cuervo Tequileria more than 2 stars.

Blah... Standard, frozen, pre-prepped restaurant food... bland.
The pork nachos were OK, but the cheese was not very good and there was minimal pork on the marginal, kinda stale tortilla chips. The rice, beans, and lettuce were, again, standard restaurant cheap stuff from a restaurant supply. Gross... My chicken 'burritos' were bland with minimal chicken and nasty cheese. Service was slow, as stated by others.
Never again!
They charged my credit card twice on Friday when I only had one purchase and I'm pretty sure the waitress added a higher tip as well... I can't even find a number to call them on to fix this
The take away burrito wasn't too bad actually. I was in a hurry to get on my plane but the order only took 5 minutes. Carnitas was tasty.

Ate here while I was on a layover.  A great way to sample the whole Jose Cuervo line, including the 1800. Silver, and Reposado tequilas.  Even though the restaurant was in an airport and had a lot of people coming and going, I still felt relaxed and not rushed.

The shrimp tacos came on two soft blue tortillas each and exceeded my expectations.  The main course was accompanied by a generous serving of black beans and a small serving of chips and salsa. 

My margarita on the rocks was very good!  I wanted to stay for another, but I had to jet.

The service was friendly and I enjoyed my visit here.

We all know airports are a bit pricey but this is pathetic. Stopped in for a needed drink and ordered a margarita assuming a Mexican place would know how to dish up a nice one - WRONG! I watched as he poured the same mix that you get at the grocery store into a glass with ice and dropped it in front of me - just a glass of cheap syrup... after A sip I asked politely if the bartender could give it a little more 'kick' with some tequila and he said "well I already put 3 shots in" (complete lie, I watched him make it). so I asked for a little more anyway. it still tasted cheap and bland but I just drank it and called for the check ... which was $24.99!!!! WTF really? for a cup of premix and a shot of tequila. this place is pathetic. If someone is willing to pay $25 for a drink the least you could do is make it a good one. I hate this place... DO NOT GO THERE it is bland menu food also (which i already knew from previous experience), but even worse drink menu. I was tempted to refute the tab but didn't want to create a fuss$14 for the glass of premix syrup + $8.99 for a (small) shot of tequila. I felt conned big time. this place cheats you with extreme rip off prices (even for airport standards). Even when I am on the business expense I will refuse to go back here.

I'm giving this a 4 instead of a 3 star rating just because my chimichanga was delicious and filling. It comes with shredded beef, corn, lettuce, tomato, and then topped with cheese. The server literally stood above me as I ate while she was at her cash register. The rice that was served with my meal was the blandest Mexican rice I've ever had, but like I said before, the chimichanga was great.

If you're hungry and need something filling before hopping on a plane then come here. Don't expect great service though.

Service: 3 stars. Fast but she really didn't do too much.

Food: 1 star. This place does not live up to its name. Not in the least. The Mangorita was baaaad. Food was terrible! Barbacoa tacos were lukewarm. Hubby got Nachos. Again lukewarm. Cheese was gross. Bad day/good day, either way, it is not acceptable on any day to be this bad. Then they have what's called Mexican style and American style tacos. First off, it was awkward when the waiter asked which style we would like. Secondly, I'm American. I love my American style cuisine. But when I go to a restaurant to eat Mexican. I want... wait for it... Mexican style food. If I want a variation, let me ask for it. Also, when I ask for tacos, just give me tasty tacos. I don't care what style you do. Make them good. 

I will say, airport restaurants are hit or miss. Mostly miss. This was a definite miss by a long shot. Walk one shop down and get a Starbucks with one of their box lunches. You'll be happy you did.

Horrid food and service. Waited 15 minutes while wait staff stood along the walls. Asked if I could order and I was told my server would be there in a minute. 10 minutes later, I left. Went around the corner to their fast food option.  Burrito was filled with hard crunchy rice. Stay away.

Grabbed some nachos before the trip home.  They were good not great not really even good but it was food in an airport so there! Waitress was super nice and efficient.  My husband broke a bottle of hot sauce and she didn't even care. Ha.  Place is crowded because people really don't want to sit at the gate.

Service was good.  I choose a table on the outside of the restaurant so I could people watch while enjoying a snack and drink.  

Prices are very high... so much that I regretted not just grabbing some trail mix and a soda from a concession stand.  Next time in LAS with time to kill I'll try a different spot.

Wow, seems like I should have read the reviews first before dining here.  Goodness.  On the other hand, maybe it's best I didn't, as I never would have eaten here, and honestly, my experience was not that bad.

During our layover, the closest place to our gate was this restaurant.  It really didn't even matter what the restaurant was, we would've eaten here anyway due to its proximity.  Luckily, it was Mexican food which I generally enjoy.

Started off with guacamole and chips.  Did not expect to receive the biggest dollop of guacamole I have ever been given by any restaurant ever in my life selling guacamole.  Holy cow.  It was creamy not chunky, which is fine.  Slightly over salted (according to my husband), but edible and filling.

We split the taquitos and the chicken tacos.  First of all the taquitos were very good.  Pretty decent portion too.  Very savory, nice flavor.  Satisfying in the way fried Mexican food can be satisfying.  As for the tacos, we got them on corn toritillas.  The plate came with three, and again, decent portion and very satisfying.  I liked my meal.  Did not leave feeling disappointed as far as the food goes.  It tasted pretty fresh, and looked pretty on the plate.

The service could use a tweak.  It took forever to be waited on, and then forever to receive the check.  But it was extremely packed in there, so perhaps that's the risk of dining in an airport restaurant.

I'm not sure what others were expecting when eating here.  I suppose we were just starving and ready to go home, so were easily pleased.  I dunno.  But our experience certainly wasn't awful or 1-2 star worthy.

Nice place to stop in for breakfast while waiting for your flight. The nachos were very good the burrito was just ok. I asked for cheese and they left it off.. Come on?! Cheese makes everything better! Service was very quick which is important because you don't always have a lot of time before boarding.

Don't stop here if you need to make a flight.  Even if you feel like you have plenty of time.  The place is mass confusion.  Nobody seems to know which table they're waiting on.  Management needs to rethink their process.  Food and drink were decent but not worth the stress.

Definitely an airport restaurant - no mistaking that! I got the Shrimp Tacos and we shared the Nachos with Pork. The Nachos were better than I had anticipated, but the Shrimp Tacos were just plain silly - they came with some sort of pathetic 1000 Island dressing trying to cop a Chipotle accent. Stop it!
Mediocre. Chicken nachos were cold chips with a cheese sauce poured on top. Carnitas quesadilla was decent, but had little to no flavor.
Server was a sweetie but that is NOT good food. Canned refried beans, salsa on huevos rancheros? Nasty

Service started out slow. We had been sitting for over 5 minutes before anyone even acknowledged us. Took our drink order and then hurried away before I had finished. Did the same thing when we were ordering our food...had to reel him back in just to finish the order.

Food was actually pretty good for airport food. The chicken quesadilla was average but the pork nachos were delicious.
Only because its an unknown in a busy airport does this place stay open. Bland, microwave looking food at airport prices. I would rather go to Taco Bell. Do NOT waste your money.

Guys, this is an airport. I get it. Food is gonna suck. But this is a new level of suck. The fries tasted off and pickled onions were way too sweet. The salsa tasted like tomato sauce. We asked a server to trade it out and she wanted to charge us for it. 2.95 for a different salsa. Okaaaay? We said we weren't given a choice of salsas when we ordered. She asked again "so you didn't like this one at all?" Um. No? We tried the green chili one and it was somehow worse. My mistake. I'll take the marinara salsa back. 

My partners burger was something off a kids menu. 

We ate it sadly because we were starving and hungover. I wish we had stopped at the chips and salsa and gone to Pei Wei... 

Turn around and walk far away. Had to have been one of the worst dining experiences of my life.

Acceptable For airport food it was very acceptable. The place was clean, the staff was nice, the prices were acceptable and they make an acceptable Bloody Mary. Overall, this is an acceptable place for sit down food while waiting on your flight.

Drinks, yes. Breakfast, NO!!

Coming back from Vegas and wanted to get a decent breakfast since I knew it'd be a while before I could eat again between the flight, the drive and other commitments. Walked past the bagel place and Burger King- went for this place thinking I could get a decent, sit down breakfast.

This was the laziest, crummiest breakfast I've had in a long time. For $8.00, I got a plate of "faux eggs" (you know those watery- light colored reconstituted powdery crappy things) with some cold shredded "cheese" thrown on top and a couple cold tortillas. Not good. Not good at all. Next time, I'll just get a bagel or even Burger King would have been a better option.

Go here for drinks. That's it.

Tacos were cold... Not lukewarm but cold. With only 6 items on the menu they obviously don't care. Spicy mango margarita was gross. Server was nice but service was slow in general as there are too few working. Hope you read reviews before eating in an airport.

Gotta love showing up and having your server say "what do you want" 
Well we ordered 2 margaritas and a draft beer. The beer was flat and the margaritas tasted like straight sugar, and that was just the drinks. We then ordered chips and salsa and must have gotten the bottom of the bucket because the chips were all broken as if a child had jumped up and down on them like they were bubble wrap. 
Oh well thanks to our server Beth for being pleasant.... Not. Really appreciated having my straws for my water thrown at me.
I had a nice meal. Nachos with spicy chorizo. They didn't go wrong with this one. Chorizo is probably only available at breakfast though, I don't know.

So after 4 days in Vegas, I needed sone good ole hangover food.  Ordered a good ole chimichanga and a goose town IPA.  I couldn't be happier.  The meat wasn't dry.  The chimichanga was cooked just right.  Rice wasn't greasy.  Beans were fresh.  Very happy.  Now, in due fairness to other unhappier patrons, the service was kind of sketch.  Once I got my server, everything was awesome after that.  Good clean place.

Very lackluster service. The first thing the waitress said to us was "I'll get to you in a minute". I realize that it's busy and in an airport but it's also filled with travelers with limited amounts of time who are also stressed out from being in an airport 

After asking the server what we should order that we could expect to receive and eat quickly within our 45 minute time frame and let her know exactly when we needed to leave we made our orders. We received our food right about the time we really needed to be getting up to go.  We ended up running to our plane and boarding last without actually finishing what we ordered. 

The food was decent from what I could tell. 
I scarfed a little of what I had ordered because I was really hungry so I can't say that I actually tasted it much.

What better way to end your Vegas trip with more alcohol before your flight??  This restaurant is located within steps of the Southwest gates.  Me and my girls walked in Saturday around lunch time with one thing in mind: bloody marys!

They have a station at the bar where you can order drinks to-go; they'll put it for you in a plastic cup n send you off to your plane.  The bartender we ordered from was very patient with us.  We originally asked for 3 bloody mary's and the count kept inching up to 9 as the rest of our girls found us and wanted one for themselves! Not the best bloody mary but hey, it'll do if you're stressed out or just want to relax while waiting for your flight. Not bad for $9.88 each.

If you sit in the restaurant they have a variety of bloody mary's and serve it to you in a glass.

If you have a lot of time to kill in Terminal C of Las Vegas airport and are hungry, this is a decent place to go.  Okay food, good drinks, nice seating.  Something other than the airport's version of fast food.

The food in this place is OK (it was not particularly hot). Not much better than Taco Bell, to be honest, but when waiting for a Southwest flight at McCarran you don't have a lot of good options.

The prices are high, as they always are at an airport, but not ridiculous.

The service on the other hand, was abysmal. Not particularly slow or anything like that, but I do expect some small degree of courtesy from a server. We were treated in a totally offhand manner, and the server got our order wrong. No hello, thank you, goodbye, have a nice flight, etc. I would classify this woman as rude, to be frank.

Next time, we'll just eat at Burger King or Sbarro.

Ripoff central! We had a brief layover in Vegas and wanted to treat ourselves to a snack and a beer at the end of our vacation. Some Mexican food sounded like it would hit the spot so we walked into the Tequileria.

It looked a bit dirty and disorganized in the restaurant even though it wasn't a super busy travel day. It's self seating but we didn't see our server for several minutes. The whole time it seemed that the server was trying to nickel and dime us. There are two sizes of draft beers on the menu, and instead of asking which size we would want the server quickly left with our order and brought back the huge and more expensive size for my mom and the wrong beer for me. The prices for the beer were steep - I was charged $8 for a bottle of Corona. After we had taken about two sips, the server was already trying to push another round on us.

We wanted something to snack on so we opted for the nachos with chicken. They were pretty gross and also a big ripoff. It tasted like they used cheese from a can and the chicken was cold and flavorless. I think we paid about $15 for something that was stale and had poor ingredients. When it was time for us to pay, the server was carrying the credit card around without the bill or the folder. This made me a bit nervous because it would have been a lot easier to use it for the wrong table or misplace it.

Avoid! Avoid!

The service was really nice he stopped by and I have come here many times before a flight. I'm not really sure why the restaurant has such bad reviews because I have had a very positive experience several times. Today I ordered mahi-mahi tacos with the jicama salsa and a side of beans and rice and I was very impressed. We also had a bloody Mary. I would highly recommend this place to anyone before or after a flight that felt like some decent Mexican food.

We sat here for twenty minutes and still don't have our beverages. After 40 minutes the burger came out well done instead of medium rare and the French fries were cold. In the hour we were her we saw Danny the manager go table to table and apologize for the food and the service. Horrible excuse for a restaurant.

For an airport restaurant, I have never had such horrible service. Luckily we had extra time before our flight or we never would have made it. Waited 20 minutes for our order to be taken and another 10 minutes for our drinks. When we finally got our food, it was cold, greasy and not what we had ordered. The waitress ran around like she had never been a waitress before.  Many people got up and walked out, I'm assuming to catch their flight and without getting anything to eat. Horrible!  Go buy a sandwich from a kiosk and save yourself the headache!
I guess my experience was different from the rest. I really liked their chorizo breakfast burrito. I had a great experience, and I have eaten a lot of airport "food."

Disappointing! My bf and I stopped in for a drink and light snack in between flights and decided we shouldn't order food based on quick look around... The place smelled like a dirty rag which was almost nauseating. We sat down at the bar for a drink and the dishes were piled up, occupying about 4 feet of bar space. We ended up leaving after our first drink and went over to the Pei Wei bar which had much better service.

Really disappointed with this place. Walked in and waitress looked bugged That I even walked in. Not friendly at all. After a good while of sitting down (nobody telling me seat yourself) the waitress came over. When I was telling her my order she was trying to walk away. I ordered a steak burrito which was horrible. Wish I would have known it was this bad and should have gone to Burger King were the staff looks friendly.

Hey, it's airport food and you get to sit down to eat it rather than having to wait in a line with badly behaved children and adults for crappy food. So they earn a star just for having table service available. They earn another star because the waitress I had was very nice and food came out quickly. I ordered the mahi mahi tacos and they were decent. Not super flavorful, but they were hot and clearly made to order which is a plus. If I were comparing this to other airport food options rather than reviewing it on it's own merits, I'd probably give it four stars, but I definitely wouldn't choose to come here if it were a restaurant in my neighborhood.

Ordered the carnita tacos. Unfortunately,
I thought they were way too salty.  They should cut down the salt a lot and allow the customers to add salt if they wish.
Order was wrong and my burrito tasted like ass. I fly every week and my expectations are low to begin with but my balls after a marathon probably smell and taste better than this burrito
Tasteless watery rice, cafeteria food taste, overpriced.  Service was fine.  Not exactly it's own restaurant - run by HMS Host.

I really didn't want a sandwich so we decided to try Mexican.  Total miss with the queso and salsa and their menu even seemed bland. I decided to go with the Taco salad since that looked the most appealing from looking at Yelp photos.   I got a a salad, not in a taco shell, and a few tortilla strips on top.  The salad was very bland.
Go for the sandwich. Not a fan.  I'm giving 1 star for the food and an extra for the waitress. She was really sweet and on top of service.

Pretty decent airport food with top notch service! 

Needed a spot to chill and get some work done before my flight, and got a gigantic Dos Equis and the Carnitas Smothered Burrito (at the suggestion of my awesome waitress). Hit the spot, got the work done, closed the deal. Not bad at all for a random vegas airport resto.

Our flight was delayed flying out of the Las Vegas airport so we were stuck at the airport for almost three hours. I got quite hungry and made my rounds to all the food places to eat but nothing seemed appetizing...when I came to this PACKED place, this is where I wanted to eat-plus it was right next to our terminal C14..I ordered the nachos with carnitas and let me tell you, for a minute , I forgot I was at the airport...MYFOOD WAS SO YUMMY - Great service too , thanks Angelina !!! Great way to end our vacation :-)

This place is great! The staff was absolutely personable and attentive. We have enjoyed our margaritas and chips. 

A perfect spot at the airport! Here,everyone was happy. 

Oh btw,their chicken taquitos were delicious!

Omg, we had a couple hours to kill before flying home and grabbed some Mexican food at the airport, it was phenomenal. The hot salsa had just the right amount of kick, my wife got a 3 taco meal and they were loaded! I had a chicken quesadilla and it was one of the best I have ever had. I would recommend grabbing a bite to eat the next time you're in Sin City

The question we often ask ourselves between connecting flights in airports is "Where am I gonna find a drink and food that won't kill me?"

Maybe it's just me. I've wandered the McCarran airport several times, but now I've found a solid place for a drink and food. We sat in the bar area and decided on a couple drinks. 

I ordered the Top Shelf Margarita, because I deserved it before the next long leg of our flight. My guy ordered a beer and when the lady asked if we wanted a shot for $2 with that, immmmm yes of course he does. 

We split the shrimp taco plate which was good small lunch for two. It comes with two big shrimp tacos, rice, beans and chips. 

Everything was pretty good for airport food. Ha! I'm kidding, Señor Cuervo.

An above-average airport spot.  I was there on National Margarita Day - 2/21 - Yay!  Only I had a beer, Rita's were a bit pricy.

Any who -- I had a chopped salad & was able to sub pork al pastor for the grilled chicken.  Great call!  The Al pastor flavor was very nice & a great complement to the cilantro dressing on the chopped salad.

Friendly service & easy in and out.  Best part was I could see my gate & was able to sit comfortably until they started boarding.
Quality of the burger is pretty mediocre. The beer is overpriced at $10+ for a pint. I would not eat here again. You're better off eating from Starbucks or the BBQ farm place.

Terrible service. It to 40 minutes (by the clock) to get a passable quesadilla and a beer , for which I was charged $25. The only table available when I sat down was two dueces pushed together as a four top. When I saw two friends looking for a table I invited them to join me at the adjoining table. The waitress refused to serve them unless they found their own table because she had already taken my order. 

I later joined three friends at the bar and ordered the same draft I had at the table for each of us. The glass was half the size but the charge was the same. 

 I have never run across a place that charges so much for so little and gives you such attitude. There must be 40+ more restaurants at McCarran,  any must be a better choice.

We sat 20 minutes without any service as everyone around us got served. I went to the server's station to let them know we had not gotten water and also ask them if we could have service. They said "Oh yea, your server is really busy with his section, and I can't put in your order in because it's his table." No offer to fix it. Just kind of a shoulder shrug. Okay. So we moved to a different table in someone else's section (we hadn't ordered anything and the restaurant has an open seating policy). As we moved, the server whose section we moved to asked us what we were doing and why I was holding a glass of water in a sort of weird accusatory voice. Then when we explained what was going on, she got irritated and said "Well [your initial] server is probably slammed right now. So that's probably why." The rest of the service was all right, but you could tell our server was overwhelmed.

I don't know what sort of inner turmoil is going on here, but it's not a great place to be a customer or to seemingly work.

After a flight that was delayed 3 hours and needing a place to eat I stopped in here. $6.50 for chips and salsa and $3.00 for a totally flat soda. Order the chips and salsa and the waitress says 'I'll get them for you when I have a chance to get to the kitchen.'  Ummm okay? Menu is small so I decided on the Caesar salad. $11. Bad idea. Lettuce was brown and it's clearly a very basic bagged Caesar salad from the grocery store. So much for the 'garlic croutons and creamy Caesar dressing. Ha!' Service is subpar. While eating my salad an employee rolls a cart through the restaurant with a huge vat of salsa on it. Ugh. Way overpriced for what it is..should have gone to Pei Wei. Food is always fast and consistent there..lesson learned.

You can't beat the location of this place in Terminal C in Las Vegas airport.  We all know that the food is barely edible, but who cares?!  It's a nice spot to have a drink or something (simple) to eat while waiting for your flight.   The waitresses/bartender  work their you-know-what's off and are so pleasant.  Yes, they get slammed and you might have to rush them along a bit, but it's fine.  It's the airport and everyone they encounter is probably hungover, tired and crabby!!! Lol Hats off to them!

Last meal before leaving Vegas...

Self-seating. Takes awhile for the server to come greet, but I don't blame them with how disorganized this place is. However, our server was extremely friendly :)

Ordered: 
Chicken Fajita Burrito (minus the chicken and cheese) - was decent. Definitely not an authentic Mexican burrito... but it did it's job and made me full as can be.

$11 beers... what the redonkulous? Only in Vegas...

WTF you guys!
1 Dos Equis ON TAP 7.99
1 Gold marg in sippy cup 12.99
tax 1.70
= bendmeover no dinner first
No likey
No likey one bit

I feel like every time I fly out of McCarran I'm on the far side of Terminal 1. Walking, walking, walking.... to reach my gate. I usually get there with enough time to stop for a drink or snacks at this tequileria. Their Jack n Cokes are about $12 each, but you can make it a double, in a tall glass, for only $4 more. So $64 plus tip got us a couple of rounds of airport-strength drinks. Can't complain about the price though when you have good service (or, when youre ordering drinks from an airport in Vegas at all! No complaining in Vegas!!!)

Thankfully, Stacie was AWESOME. She sold us on the doubles... twice! She was very friendly and social and just fun to have at our table. Even put the second round into plastic cups so we could walk around and gamble with them. You could tell she loves her job by the way she interacted with us, and even how she introduced herself to the tables near us as well.

I ended up not eating here, but I did get some salsa to go, to dip French fries in. I'm not kidding.... I had two-day old garlic fries, ordered with room service in our hotel, and one-day old McDonalds fries, both of which I'd packed up in our rush to leave. So... yeah, at the end of a $3,000 weekend I had no problem saving money and eating something from the night before. Though, I guess I always eat weird leftovers! ;)

I started to browse a menu from my table after sitting down for breakfast, and was immediately grossed out by what appeared to be avocado smeared on the first page. I grabbed the other one... Grease stains. Maybe chorizo. Let's try the next table over... Definitely salsa on this one.  As I'm sitting there squinting at other tables trying to spot a new-looking menu, a female server whooshes over to my table with a scowl and snatches one of the grimy menus and returns it to the table that I took it from. No welcome, no hello... Just a hit and run menu snatching.  Luckily she was not my server; I don't think that we would have gotten along.  My server turned out to be Maggie, who was prompt and friendly.  Thanks to her my day got started with about 4 glasses of coffee and a smile.  

No help from the food though, or the prices. I got the huevos, scrambled, with chorizo, home fries, and tortillas. The plate lacked any sort of garnish (cheese?  Sour cream? Pico de gallo?) and the side of salsa I asked for was 3 bucks. 3 bucks for a couple spoonfuls of salsa!!?  Good thing I didn't know about that charge til I got my bill, or I might have had a salsa free breakfast. The 'home fries' reminded me of the chewy cubes of frozen potatoes you used to get in middle school cafeteria with your French Toast sticks and oj with a peel back aluminum lid.  

3 bucks for a side of salsa??!?  You kidding me?!  

You'd be better off getting a Naked Juice protein shake from the Hudson's News store and coming here for booze if you feel so inclined.
The margarita was very good. I liked my chicken quesadilla. Waitress is very friendly, but it was a little high-priced for my budget.

I am not a fan of airport restaurants, and this place will not change that. The food and drinks are average. I really do not like the fact that this place is NOT kid friendly. This airport location was a connection for me and my family and during the layover; my wife and I ate here but I had to buy food at the next door Burger King and Sbarro for my three kids. It was cool that they allowed us to bring in this food (our server agreed they are not kid friendly) and that is good or otherwise we would have just walked out. It's not that my kids do not like Mexican food, there is only a chicken quesadilla that would qualify as kid-food and $13 is an outrageous price to pay for the size (yes airport food is always too high).

I would come back here to eat...not a whole lot of other options without walking to another place in the airport....and no airport food is worth that.

Stay away. They served the worst burritos I have had in 20 years.  And I have been to hundreds of Mexican restaurants.

I had the steak burrito.  At first is was OK, since all I tasted was beans and cheese. But once I got to the beef, it was not edible. 

I never return food, but it was so bad I couldn't get more than a 1/4 into it. I felt it was my civic duty to complain.  I returned it for a chicken burrito.

Aack. It was as bad as the beef.  After two bites, I just tossed it in the nearest trash can.

To add insult to injury, there were no prices posted on the drinks and they charged me $4.29 of a bottle of ice tea.

Yea it's the airport but Wow by far the worst Mexican food I have had in my life I went the safe route got the nachos, but damn these were bad soggy chips with sour cream and cheese straight from a tube and pile of onions on top for about 12 bucks, should have gotten the damn taquitos!!!. just need to stick with my tradition of an Irish  coffee at the Irish joint, all the food at he airport sucks

Stale chips and salty guacamole.  It was just a snack before boarding our flight back home from Las Vegas but I guess for the price I expected actually hand-cut and fried corn tortilla chips.  Service was slow although that could have been because it was in the airport where it was pretty busy. 

Took forever to get our bill.

Ordered nachos without meat, which knocked $2 off the price. Asked for jalapeños on the side, which added $1.50 to the price. You know you are dealing with quality meat when it costs the same as pickled hot peppers from a can.

The degree of suck exhibited by this place is astounding. Understaffed, so the draining of one's wallet to dine here is excruciatingly slow. They like to make the pain last.

Airports are typically known for bad and overpriced food, but this is a new simultaneous nadir and zenith - which I suppose is impressive if you think about it, on a certain level.

The only way I'd come back to this place would be to relieve myself on the floor.

Not a bad place to stop if you're waiting for a flight, but be prepared to leave with your wallet much lighter. 

I stopped here since it was outside of my gate and a margarita sounded good. The waitress recommended the Ultimate Margarita since it wasn't much more expensive than the house and you get more booze. I asked how much they were, and I should have braced myself. $14-something for a house and $16 for the Ultimate. Wow. But, I was set on a margarita at this point so I decided to shell out for the Ultimate. It was good! Well made and strong, but had a wonderful balance between the booze and other ingredients. 

I also ordered some chips and guacamole. This was pricey as well at $10.99. The guacamole was great but the chips left something to be desired. They seemed like they were something you'd buy on the grocery store shelves. In the end though, they were just a vehicle for the guac! 

Service was friendly and good, but they all did seem burnt out. I heard they were hopping all day.

Good place to chill if you have a 2 hour delay. I actually met up with my sister here (she was leaving from Terminal C and I was at Terminal B). It is a far walk from Terminal B so get ready to get your exercise on. The service was pretty good. Our waitress was very nice and efficient. It was about an hour before closing time and she did tell us when they were closing but wasn't pushy about it. We ordered the Baja Shrimp Tacos and the Southwest Chicken Chopped Salad. Both were pretty good. Could've also been because we were starving from traveling all day...this was our stopover destination. If you have time, I definitely recommend sitting down and ordering food versus buying a sandwich from one of the convenience stores...those sandwiches were dry and flavorless. Not sure if I would ever have a chance to come back here but it's not as bad as I thought it would be.

My flight was delayed and I just wanted to sit down and have a bite to eat since I hadn't had breakfast or lunch and it would be a long time before I could have any kind of dinner.

I looked at Nathan's Hot Dogs, since I haven't had them in years. Two hot dogs and fries would run close to $14. I kept looking and found Tequileria. There were tables and chairs. I looked at the menu and saw the prices were quite reasonable for an airport.

I ordered the chimichanga platter expecting a small microwaved burrito type thing. What I received was one of the largest chimichangas I've ever gotten. Along with tri-colored chips, rice, black beans, salsa, and picante. I expected the cheese, sour cream, and guacamole chimichanga to be mostly empty but it was pack with pork carnitas. There was no air inside it at all. 

The pork was tender and fell apart easily even using the plastic fork. It tasted good. If this was a frozen chimichanga that was just microwaved then I'd like to know who makes them and sells them. 

My server, Sonya, was also very pleasant and attentive even while being really busy. I never saw her stand still unless she was talking to a customer.

Water and the chimichanga cost $11.88. That's slightly more than a Sam Adams at one of the bars. For a restaurant dining experience in an airport in Las Vegas, that's kind of hard to beat.

Was "stuck" in Vegas airport on a 4-hour layover (really should have just left the airport and explored The Strip), I was hungry for breakfast and didn't have a lot of options. I have had Tequileria before for a quick quesadilla in-between flights and it's pretty hard to screw up a cheese quesadilla. But today was the first time I actually sat down and ate in the restaurant. 

My server was friendly enough and took my drink order right away (just a glass of water) - but then it was 10 minutes before I saw the water, or her, again. It was breakfast so I ordered the Huevos Rancheros. The food came out fairly quickly. 

The eggs were cooked well, as were the "home fries", but everything else was a mediocre, soggy mess. Too much salsa, cold tortillas, cold beans, and overall a kind of "blah" breakfast. I was hungry so I ate it, unfortunately - then discovered better breakfast options in other terminals of the airport. Live and learn.

Normally, I get a burrito from Blue Burrito then head over to my favorite watering hole, Corcoran's.  However, I didn't have much time this trip, so i stopped by Jose Cuervo Tequileria to have a beer and Blue Burrito.

Food - This time I had their veggie burrito.  It was beans, rice, lettuce, tomato, sour cream, cheese, and guacamole.  They put way too much lettuce in this burrito.  Normally I have a steak or chicken burrito....but opted for the veggie.  While it tasted good, the lettuce drowned out the other flavors.

Atmosphere - It's a fun bar to hang out at.  Plenty of seats and FREE Wifi.

Will I return?  Yes, but probably won't order the veggie next time.

I am pushed to even give this one star. Rarely have I seen worse service. Went to bar to order a beer. They said to get a seat and a server would look after me. I sat down and noticed the table top device to press to get your servers attention.  

I pressed it once and saw that the servers were alerted at their station. 

However nothing happened and they were watching the TV and having some conversation. 

I waited and then after a couple more minutes I pressed for attention again. 

Same again.  I could se their buzzers light that they were wearing and yet again nothing. 

After another couple minutes I pressed again and yet again same thing. 

I am sorry but at this point I really had had enough. I got up and spoke quite harshly to the staff because the had just ignored a customer. 

I think my annoyance was well deserved and I said it was unacceptable as they had just stood and ignored a customer. 

0 stars!!!!!!!!

Short Story:
Airport food...what can you expect?

Long Story:
Last meal before leaving Vegas.  My co-workers and I got 2 nacho dishes and some chips.  It was okay.  I mean, it's bar food.  It held me over until I landed in San Jose to go eat real food.  I have nothing against this place, I'm just saying it's really average.

Verdict:
Meh...
Good food but very very pricey. It's in the airport so that's why. Clean restaurant. Took a while to get our order in but when finally greeted my waitress she was really nice.

Waiting for my plane and this was the only choice.  Jose Cuervo, not a fan.  As Matt stated, it's a bar in an airport.  Indeed.  

Service sucked. Burned out humans.

The food was good and obviously the alcohol too. It was a lot of food though; couldn't finish it all. Ordered chips and salsa to begin with. I ordered hot sauce but it wasn't really spicy. Shortly later ordered few beers and shots. I got 3 tacos and she got enchiladas. Both were good but too much to eat it all. I got so full that I couldn't order more beer. 

When we first got in, we were sat in odd corner between two big families and waiter was cool enough to clean another table so we could get more privacy.

Is it possible to give no stars, or maybe just an angry emoji? 

Can't comment on the food because couldn't get service long enough to order any. The waitstaff was SO miserable that it made me realize why some people don't believe in raising minimum wage. I literally think these managers go out of their way to find the waitresses from HELL because it was unlike anything I'd ever seen. Thank God It's an airport restaurant because I couldn't WAIT to leave Vegas after that experience. 

Good luck, and steer CLEAR of a waitress named Melonie.

One star is being generous.  For a restaurant operating at an airport, to wait 45 minutes for a salad is unacceptable.  Not only that, we asked for margaritas with no salt and got salt.  So yourself a favor an stay away.
